p: The powdered plant materials (250 g) were macerated using 80% methanol (3 Ã— 2 L, 72 h each). Then the plant extracts were filtered and the methanol in the filtrate was removed using a rotary evaporator (Buchi, Switzerland). The concentrated extract was dried with a lyophilizer (Wagtech, Denmark). Finally, the crude extracts of D. peninervium, O. integrifolia, U. simensis and F. communis yielded 12.5%, 16.6%, 24.4%, and 10.15% respectively.
